questions.question: She ……………………….. red and ran out of the room.
questions.description: Turn is common before color words. It is used to talk about visible changes of state.

questions.question: Alice is the person ………………………… keeps a deer in the garden shed.
questions.description: We use who to refer to people.

questions.question: A deer is …………………………. Alice keeps in the garden shed.
The baby’s eyes are not at all the same color ………………………… yours.
questions.description: We can use the structure same …as to say that people or things are similar.

questions.question: She looks ……………………. older than her daughter.
questions.description: We can use no to modify a comparative word.

questions.question: I haven’t seen him ………………………… ages.
questions.description: We use for to indicate duration.

questions.question: Samuel and ………………………. decided to split up.
questions.description: Contractions are not normally written with double subjects.

questions.question: The village ……………………….. I live is very beautiful.
If you have already had measles, you are unlikely to get …………………………… again.
questions.description: The names of illnesses are usually uncountable in English and hence we use singular pronouns to refer back to them.

questions.question: I have difficulty …………………………… dates.
questions.description: The preposition ‘in’ can be dropped out after difficulty.

questions.question: My grandfather is eighty-five but he still enjoys ……………………….. health.
questions.description: Health is an uncountable noun. We cannot use an article with it.

questions.question: Have you bought the …………………………?
questions.description: Although groceries is an uncountable noun, it has no singular form.
